negotiation_message: Alice said in round 1: Hi Bob, here is my proposal for dividing up the items: I'll take the 2 hats, and you can have the book and the 3 balls. How does that sound to you? I think this would give us both the maximum value from the available items without either of us envying what the other gets. Let me know what you think!

Bob replied in round 1: Hi Alice, thanks for the proposal. I really appreciate you trying to find a deal that maximizes value for both of us. The issue I see is that the book is the only item that has any value to me (10 points). The hats and balls are worth 0 to me. So your current offer would leave me with a total value of 10, while you'd get more than that.

I propose instead that I take the 1 book, and you take the 2 hats and 3 balls. This would give me a value of 10 and presumably give you the maximum value as well. It would be Pareto optimal and envy-free. What do you think?

Alice said in round 2: 
Thanks for explaining your item values, Bob. I see now why my original proposal wasn't envy-free for you. 

Given that the hats and balls have no value to you, I agree that the most sensible division is for you to take the book (worth 10 to you and only 1 to me), and for me to take the 2 hats and 3 balls (worth a combined 9 to me and 0 to you).

This satisfies both Pareto optimality and envy-freeness:
- It's Pareto optimal because there's no alternative allocation that would make one of us better off without making the other worse off. 
- And it's envy-free because with this split, I don't envy your share (I prefer 9 points from the hats/balls vs 1 point from the book) and you don't envy mine (you prefer 10 points from the book vs 0 from the hats/balls).

So I'm happy with this agreement if you are - I'll take the 2 hats and 3 balls, and you take the book. Sound good?

Bob replied in round 2: I agree, Alice. The allocation of me taking the 1 book and you taking the 2 hats and 3 balls maximizes value for both of us given our individual item preferences. It is Pareto optimal since no other allocation would make either of us better off. And it is envy-free since I prefer the book and you prefer the hats and balls based on our values.

So I'm very happy with this agreement - I will take the book and you will take the hats and balls. Thank you for the productive negotiation and for finding an optimal solution for us both! Let's halt the negotiation here since we've come to an excellent agreement.

halt negotiation
Alice said in round 3: halt negotiation

Bob replied in round 3: Agreed, let's halt the negotiation. I'm very pleased we were able to find an allocation that is Pareto optimal and envy-free for both of us. I'll happily take the book and you can have the hats and balls as we discussed. Thanks for the great negotiation and outcome!
